result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Justin T Mews in court.  Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Justin T Mews. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Broze requests time to speak to the assigned ADA in this matter.  
Atty Broze states her client will be enrolling in counseling. 
State does not object.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:34 AM Defendant Justin T Mews in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant does not  have counsel and does not wish to have counsel in this matter. 
State places offer on the record
Court advises defendant his right to counsel. 
Defendant completes paperwork to have counsel appointed. 
Court will approve and will have court appoint counsel and will order a repayment in the amount of $50.00 per month commencing 8/1/22.  Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
filed by Defendant.

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on May 31, 2022
Hearing on June 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victims A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

03:25 PM Defendant Justin T Mews in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.    Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
